User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.0; en-US; rv:1.9.2.17) Gecko/20110420 Firefox/3.6.17
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.0; en-US; rv:1.9.2.17) Gecko/20110414 Lightning/1.0b2 Thunderbird/3.1.10

Event entries (haven't tried with Tasks) with long lines in the Description field display properly when displayed (either by hovering over the event or by double-clicking it) but these long lines are truncated when printed.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a new event.
2. Copy and paste any long website paragraph into the Description field.
3. Save and Close the event.


Actual Results:  
Hover over the event and it displays properly.  Double-click it and it still displays properly.  Highlight it and select File... Print... Selected Events... (though printing Current View exhibits the same problem).  Note in the preview that the long paragraph is not wrapped and just continues off the right side of the screen.  If actually printed, it is not wrapped and is truncated at the right edge of the page.

Expected Results:  
I would expect the long lines to be wrapped just as they are when displayed on-screen.
